instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165A: What is 820-00165A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_LRESET_L: What is SMC_LRESET_L? SMC_LRESET_L is a typo of SMC_RESET_L. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Board was powering up intermittent with black screen (chime) so replaced <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and Backlight was ok so began installation of Os. 
After reboot it wouldnt turn on again so found some corrosion around Y1915. Replaced both resistors and board still powering intermittent.
Board stopped turning on the only drawing 250ma black screen no chime but usb boot hdd has activity (Blink a couple of times).
All rails have correct voltages except for backlight (<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW_LCDBKLT_FET</SIGNAL>) .

PPbus has 8.58v
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> 3.43v
Reflowed SMC then reballed  but still same.
Any point in relacing Smc or what am I missing?.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
So board works, only missing backlight?
PRAM reset tried (2-3 times)?
Caps lock reacts, chime, external video?

Did you check XW7720 bridge?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi No external video  ,no chime, Usb activity on usb 3.0 hdd nothing on keyboard or mouse. Also how to check XW7720?. 
. Current jump to a little over 300ma the immediately back to 250ma. Tried Pram reset with internal keyboard but it didnt respond.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Looks like board doesn't really boot.
So no backlight issue, probably.
Very strange to get USB activity in this case...

Do you have oscillation on Y1915?
Also check <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> at <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> output.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: It originally booted but with no backlight but took a few presses of powerbutton and after I removed it from case and placed on bench it then started to boot. I replaced the Backllight Ic and had picture chime etc and began install os . Strangely the wifi acted strange and wouldnt connect during setup so rebooted it and thats when I get this status now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: Y1915 ig jumping from 12hkz to 25khz, same on <SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1</SIGNAL> should be stable 32KHz, square wave.
Did you test the board alone on the desk again?
Try disconnecting LIO flex and airport card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: I changed the probe now getting 32.hkz wave, everythign is dosconnected inc Lio cable but still same and 24mhz at Y1915

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Y1915 is not important, untill board boots
VCORE stable 1.80V?
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: Yes VCore is stable 1.8v and 0v on <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Do you get stable 3V at pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>?
If not, check pins 5/6.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Yes stable on all 3 pins

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> seems to be pulsing between 40mv to 160mv

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Check if you get al voltages at pages 57/58.
If yes, then should be PCH issue.
Heat it with quality flix.
No more than 180-200 degress, just to burn eventually accumulated crap underneath; no need to melt the balls.

Don't forget to remove SSD, airport and LIO flex for previous test.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: Yes all Voltages on page 57/58 are present. Heated Cpu to 180c with Amtech 559 flux from Rossman store but still same . Any other ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Should still be corrosion issue.
Check all resistors and traces around SMC.
Also inspect resistors under PCH.
No activity possible untill PCH releases <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal; nor even SPI chip is accessed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Any point in replacing Smc ? .
What signals are required for PCH to release <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> signal ?

Also is it normal at start it stops at 20ma for a second then jumps to 260ma?.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
PCH needs to receive confirmation that all voltages are present, in order to release <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> is latest singnal expected by PCH in this sequence.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
So probably dry joint on pch/cpu then or bad Pch

What voltage should be on <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> ? 
After reflow Im getting 3.3v should it be 1.05v?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
3.3V is correct level.
Did the symptom change now?
Also check <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Yes current draw just goes a little higher to 320mv.
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_BUF_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PCA9557D_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>SMC_LRESET_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>CAM_PCIE_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>BKLT_PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> 

Are all present and 3.3v

Where can I find a flowchart/list of the what signals/voltages should be present in correct order?.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> appears after heating PCH, could be internal problem.
Is also possible, something else reacted to heat in that area.
Check SPI Bus Serie Termination resistors and their traces, as J6100 too,
You can also try known good working BIOS..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi thanks for your assistance. I tried good clean bios and checked all the termination resistors and tracks but still the same.
It draws 340mv for a split second then drops back to 300mv

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: Any point in reheating the CPU ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Spillage around Y1915 and <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>
threads.message: You can try heating it...
